meanings.definition: To hoist or haul using a winch.
meanings.sent1: The workers winched the heavy crate up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: They winched the boat out of the water and onto the trailer.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel winched the acorn up the tree with a tiny winch.
meanings.sent4: She winched her spirits up after a tough day at work.
meanings.sent5: The winched flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, they winched the car out of the ditch.
meanings.sent2: He winched the old engine out of the garage last week.
meanings.sent3: The cat winched itself onto the high shelf and couldn't get down.
meanings.sent4: Her heart winched at the sight of the abandoned puppy.
meanings.sent5: The memories winched back into his mind, vivid and clear.
